Art. 4.56. 
Creditors appearing at a later date 
Creditors who, unknown at the time of the first payment, make themselves known at a later date, have recourse against the legatees paid for a period of three years from the date of the settlement of the account and the payment of the remainder. They have no recourse against creditors who have already been paid, but they have the right to deduct from the undistributed assets the dividends relating to their claims in the first distributions.
